Title: Help the homeless and mental health
Location: City of Birmingham, West Midlands, United Kingdom
Description: We are MENTalk is a support network for men to aid them and support them throughout their mental health journey we have a safe forum for men to talk openly and seek support and advice   along with regular events and advice from professionals   This year we need your help! We are raising funds to help the homeless and mental Health   Unfortunately homelessness and poor mental health go hand in hand Around 12 Men in the UK loose their life to suicide every day Around 2 in every 8 males suffer from a mental health problem 3/4 of adults who go missing every year are male 87% of rough sleepers are male Males are 3 times more likely to become dependent on alcohol Male’s are 3 times more likely to use drugs Around 757 000 suffer from domestic violence Around 40% of men won’t talk about their mental health struggles Less think and care about the less fortunate than ourselves   Can you imagine what it feels like to not be able to shower or clean your teeth ? Or what it feels like to not be able to eat when your hungry or change your clothes when your cold and wet ? Having people walk past you and look down upon you whilst insulting you ? Enduring long cold days and nights and just dreaming of change? This is the hard cold reality of what’s really going on in our city centres  these men are someone’s son   someone’s brother   and someone’s dad they are just men like the rest of us that have been dealt some unfortunate luck. We are committed on doing our bit to help and support them   so let’s think of them at this cold festive time. We can not change the world but we can the lives of people in this world  Please help us by donating so we can help the less fortunate than ourselves ❤️  MENTalk community members will be coming together to perform a cover of Band Aid’s do they know it’s Christmas We will also be staying on the streets on Birmingham for 48hrs to show you what’s it’s really like to be homeless         Join our private community here >https://www.facebook.com/groups/wearementalkVisit us here >https://www.mentalk.onlineLike & Share Here >https://www.facebook.com/WeAreMENTalk#community #mentalhealth #mensmentalhealth #MENTALK #anxiety #mentalhealthawareness #baxi #baxiboilers #MENTalk

Title: Keep our homeless bus shelter open
Location: Norwich, East of England, United Kingdom
Description: Norwich Homeless Support runs a ten bed converted coach housing the homeless of Norwich.    Just in the last few months we have rehoused 7 people who have come on to the bus and now rehoused in local hostels with one who now has his own room in a shared property and back working full time.     We also run a community food bank which is a vital service for those who need emergency food parcels.     We have proven the bus to work but with winter here our furniture sales have slowed down and we really need some funding in to least cover us for the next few months so we can keep the bus running.     I have put our costs below  all money is spent on keeping our services running.     Unit & storage rent: £500 this is where our bus is parked and also our storage container.   Telephone & internet system: £20 per month. This is for our landline number for people to get in touch with us.  Petrol: £100 a month to help with volunteers cars.   Waste collection: £20 a month   Portaloo: £25 a week plus vat - we need to get one down yard so we have two toilets on site.   Insurance: £110 a month.   Other costs: around £300 monthly this could be things like topping up first aid box  topping up equipment on the bus or carrying out dbs checks.   These are our main costs we need to cover every month just to run if you could please make a donation and share.   You can see what we do on our Facebook page Norwich Homeless Support.

Title: Help Me Buy For the Homeless
Description: Hi everyone  at the end of 2021 I looked back on what i’d accomplished and I realised I’d done more things for myself than for others. So i’ve decided that throughout 2022 i’m going to give to others.     My name is Liv Cowley and I’m 15 years old. Over the next few weeks/months I am going to be buying things and giving them to the homeless. However I don’t currently have a job so I would like help to raise money so I can achieve this.     I am going to go round Telford  Shrewsbury  Birmingham and if it goes well hopefully other places too!     I already have a few ideas what to buy:  - Bottled Water  - Warm Socks  - Blankets  - Deodorant  - Sanitary Products   - Hand Sanitizer  - Gloves  - Torch    Always open for suggestions. Message me through socials:  - Instagram: @livcowleyx   - Snapchat: @olivia.cowley1  - Facebook: Liv Cowley

Title: My 5K For Homeless Veterans
Location: Altrincham, North West England, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: Please support me as I run 5K a day for 10 consecutive days to help raise money for our veterans who are either sadly suffering with Post Traumatic Disorder or have found themselves homeless. The sad reality is that many heroic veterans have gone through so much  such as losing their friends on the frontline or witnessing a truly tragic event unfold in front of their eyes. No one wants to go through suffering as a result of such adverse events. After all  these heroes fight for the many freedoms that we enjoy day to day. Which is why it is important that they get the best treatment after coming home from war struck countries such as the likes of Afghanistan and Iraq. As a close friend of a mate who will be joining the army soon to go and serve  I want to do my bit to help and ensure our relentless heroes get the post-war treatment/rehabilitation that they deserve.    So thanks for taking your time out to read this and I do hope you can support me in my fundraising.    Merry Christmas

Title: Homeless Tour of UK "Walking To Freedom"
Organization: Shelter, National Campaign for Homeless People Limited
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: Walking To Freedom is going again doing what I can call a "Homeless Tour Of UK".   5th of March 2022 is set and the start and finish line is Murrayfield Stadium.    This time after walking to London from Edinburgh I would be then walking over to Wales then up the West side all the way upto Glasgow then back over to Edinburgh walking along roads and tow paths.   Homelessness is everywhere but it's just not on the streets its also in temporary accommodation where also families with young children are too and this is where your donation helps  Shelter needs donations and fundraising for them to continue the Fight For Home campaign so that no one has to sleep rough or in temporary accommodation a specially families.     The city's I would be walking through are;   Newcastle Leeds Doncaster Peterborough London Bristol Cardiff Birmingham Manchester Carlisle Glasgow   help over a million people a year struggling with bad housing or homelessness  and we campaign to prevent it in the first place. We're here so no one has to fight bad housing or homelessness on their own.Hi friends  join me in making a difference by supporting a good cause! I'm raising money for Shelter  National Campaign for Homeless People Limited and any donation will help make a difference. Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause which means so much to me.

Title: Help save Michi from homelessness
Description: i am a 19 year old trans-nonbinary creative who hopes to work in the fashion industry one day  making and designing clothes and accessories that will help all kinds of people express themselves with unique ethically made clothing in a way that feels right  my shoe design course was supposed to be the first step in that direction.now all i really want is to be able to know i’ll have a roof over my head before my 20th birthday.  what happened:on the 5th of November 2021 i found out that i’d been kicked out of university  meaning that i cannot live at my student accommodation and that i had to be fired from my job as i was also working at the accommodation i was staying at.   basically i lost my course  my job and told i was going to be homeless in the same few hours.  i contacted people at UAL for help and was told that according to their system i hadn’t enrolled  i was not aware of this and was under the impression my enrolment went through fine. i was also not allowed to reenrol late as i hadn’t attended enough lessons. the reason for that being that i have severe mental health issues that the university is very aware of.   i have fought my case to the university all i can at this point and now am just fighting to find a place to stay.   being a trans homeless youth in london is not how i wanted to spend my 20s but when the 7th of December comes i will have no choice.   i am setting up this go fund me to help with living expenses while i sort things out.  on top of this i will be:  selling a lot of my possessionsdoing art commissions selling custom designed shirtsthis will be done on my instagram and depop  i hate to ask for help but im at the point where theres nothing else i can do. thank you for reading and if you can’t donate please share <3  insta: https://instagram.com/ditziewhore?utm_medium=copy_link  paypal: https://www.paypal.me/notyourbabyx (incase you want to send me money directly)

Title: Helping Local Church Charity & Homelessness
Location: Amersham, South East England, United Kingdom
Description: Merry Christmas to you all!     We are collecting for the most wonderful local charity to us called Restore Hope & Kings Church who provide support and gifts to families. We have enjoyed some amazing fun days (see below) & baby groups over the years and would like to raise some money in gratitude.     Eloise was really moved by a homelessness advert  she wants to give a homeless person a Christmas this year  in the warm and accessing services to hopefully help them off the streets.    We have made a “Christmas single” for you to enjoy  please donate a few pennies to our cause and don’t miss the outtakes!!     ❤️ Sophie  Eloise  Archie & Delilah    P.s please do not share online I’m only sending to close friends and family  thanks for your understanding
